Posts.Content: hi everyone This month I am celebrating my 1st yr survivorship  with stage 3 cancer, I put together a video clip of my thoughts during treatment with my 8 yr old son and I wanted to come over and share with you. Here is the link http://one.revver.com/watch/282100/flv/affiliate/90478   Hope u enjoy.  And feel free to send the link to anyone u feel may need a little inspiration along the way. mel xox
Posts.Title: Sharing my chemo video .... inspirational

Posts.Content: hey Velvet and all others Ok... i am really starting to worry about ONJ .... I have been on Zometa for 18 months, as part of a trial, for stg 3 breast cancer patients, with the hope of preventing bone mets.  Last year I did chemo and during chemo i developed an abcess in my gum.  By this time I had already had 5 Zometa infusions.... hmmm.... my onc, suggested I have the tooth removed because I was severly neutopenic and an infection like an abcess could prove fatal during chemo.  I was worried about removing my tooth whilst on zometa, however my onc suggested it, so I trusted his judgement.  Recently I had to have a bone scan done because i was getting pain in my legs.  And the report said I had a hot spot in my jaw..... Could this be the early stage of ONJ?  Why cant I seem to find info on diagnosising ONJ?   Does anyone know whether onj is picked up on bone scans.  I do not have any exposed areas in gum or any of that but I am worried about if my scan is picking up early signs.  Velvet... I am in UK as well.... Brighton.   Hugs to you hun, you really are going thru a bad time... hang in there. Mel
Posts.Title: Jaw Bone Problems

Posts.Content: Thanx Velvet can you post a link for the yahoo forum... I am having trouble finding the site.
